title: Add support to gevent workers on server
body:
### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**:
Yes
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**:
Fedora release 27 (Twenty Seven)
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: 
Source
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**:
0.3.0
- **Python version**: 
2.7.14
- **npm version (if running the dev UI):
- **Exact command to reproduce**:

### Describe the problem
I was setting up a remote server on AWS with Docker (built and pushed the image from the project's Dockerfile available) on Kubernetes (through StatefulSets). However it is very hard to effectively serve gunicorn-backed servers behind an AWS ELB, as evidenced mostly in this issue: https://github.com/benoitc/gunicorn/issues/1194. Besides directly deploying on EC2, one way to circumvent this issue would be to make `gevent` workers available. There would be mostly, two additions: 

* a new optional parameter to the CLI `mlflow server`, which could something on the lines of `mlflow server -k [gevent|gunicorn]`, defaulting to gunicorn;
* pass the option along, which would trigger a call of something like:

```
exec_cmd(["gunicorn", "-k", worker_type, "-b", bind_address, "-w", "%s" % workers, "mlflow.server:app"]
``` 

### Source code / logs
I was able to quickly test this enhancement by hardcoding the worker type to the gunicorn call to test if it would correctly respond to the requests -- server starts up successfully and it is able to handle requests:


I'd be glad to help with a PR, wanted to double check if it makes sense at the first place.
